alert.note: Alert for Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 12:40PM EST until December 23 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Widespread flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. Small streams will rise rapidly and could flood low water crossings. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Franklin, Kennebec, Oxford, Somerset and Waldo. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll and Coos. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST Friday. Additional warnings possible thereafter due to continued rises on small stream and creeks. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is expected to develop early afternoon and continue into this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1217 PM EST, 1 to 2 inches of rainfall had fallen. Several more hours of moderate to heavy rainfall expected through this evening. This rainfall in addition to snowmelt will produce excessive runoff and rapid rises on area streams and creeks. - Additional warnings may be needed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Waterville, Farmington, Fairfield, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Turner, and Rumford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
